content:
Sure, here are some easy and healthy recipes that would be perfect for a potluck lunch:

1. Quinoa Salad: Cook 1 cup of quinoa (according to package directions). Mix in some cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, feta cheese, and a light vinaigrette dressing.

2. Hummus and Crudites: Serve packaged hummus with cut-up fresh vegetables such as carrots, celery, and bell peppers.

3. Fruit Salad: Cut up a variety of fresh fruits such as berries, melons, and pineapple, and toss them together in a large bowl.

4. Vegetable Skewers: Thread skewers with zucchini, yellow squash, bell peppers, and cherry tomatoes, and grill or roast them until they are tender.

5. Chicken or Tuna Salad Lettuce Wraps: Mix cooked chicken or canned tuna with Greek yogurt, celery, and onion. Serve in lettuce leaves as a low-carb sandwich option.

6. Quiche Cups: Mix eggs with your favorite veggies, cheese, and milk. Pour the mixture into muffin cups and bake until set.

7. Roasted Sweet Potato Wedges: Cut sweet potatoes into wedges and toss with olive oil and seasonings. Bake in the oven until crispy.

8. Greek Yogurt Dip: Mix Greek yogurt with fresh herbs and spices such as dill, garlic, and lemon. Serve with cut-up veggies or pita chips.

These recipes are healthy, easy to make, and perfect for sharing at potluck lunches. And best of all, they appeal to a variety of dietary preferences and restrictions. Enjoy!
